verses.verse: Abraham<WH85> took<WH3947> another<WH3254> wife,<WH802> and her name<WH8034> was Keturah.<WH6989>
She bore<WH3205> him Zimran,<WH2175> Jokshan,<WH3370> Medan,<WH4091> Midian,<WH4080> Ishbak,<WH3435> and Shuah.<WH7744>
Jokshan<WH3370> became the father of Sheba,<WH7614> and Dedan.<WH1719> The sons<WH1121> of Dedan<WH1719> were Asshurim,<WH805> Letushim,<WH3912> and Leummim.<WH3817>
The sons<WH1121> of Midian:<WH4080> Ephah,<WH5891> Epher,<WH6081> Hanoch,<WH2585> Abida,<WH28> and Eldaah.<WH420> All these were the children<WH1121> of Keturah.<WH6989>
Abraham<WH85> gave<WH5414> all that he had to Isaac,<WH3327>

but to the sons<WH1121> of Abraham<WH85>'s concubines,<WH6370> Abraham<WH85> gave<WH5414> gifts.<WH4979> He sent them away<WH7971> from Isaac<WH3327> his son,<WH1121> while he yet lived,<WH2416> eastward,<WH6924> to the east<WH6924> country.<WH776>
These are the days<WH3117> of the years<WH8141> of Abraham<WH85>'s life<WH2416> which he lived:<WH2425> one hundred<WH3967> seventy-five<WH7657> years.<WH8141>
Abraham<WH85> gave up the spirit,<WH1478> and died<WH4191> in a good<WH2896> old age,<WH7872> an old man,<WH2205> and full<WH7649> of years,<WH622> and was gathered to his people.<WH5971>

Isaac<WH3327> and Ishmael,<WH3458> his sons,<WH1121> buried<WH6912> him in the cave<WH4631> of Machpelah,<WH4375> in the field<WH7704> of Ephron,<WH6085> the son<WH1121> of Zohar<WH6714> the Hittite,<WH2850> which is before<WH6440> Mamre,<WH4471>
the field<WH7704> which Abraham<WH85> purchased<WH7069> of the children<WH1121> of Heth.<WH2845> Abraham<WH85> was buried<WH6912> there with Sarah,<WH8283> his wife.<WH802>
It happened after<WH310> the death<WH4194> of Abraham<WH85> that God<WH430> blessed<WH1288> Isaac,<WH3327> his son.<WH1121> Isaac<WH3327> lived<WH3427> by<WH5973> Beer Lahai Roi.<WH883>

Now this is the history<WH8435> of the generations<WH8435> of Ishmael,<WH3458> Abraham<WH85>'s son,<WH1121> whom Hagar<WH1904> the Egyptian,<WH4713> Sarah<WH8283>'s handmaid,<WH8198> bore to Abraham.<WH85>

These are the names<WH8034> of the sons<WH1121> of Ishmael,<WH3458> by their names,<WH8034> according to the order<WH8435> of their birth:<WH1060> the firstborn of Ishmael,<WH3458> Nebaioth,<WH5032> then Kedar,<WH6938> Adbeel,<WH110> Mibsam,<WH4017>
Mishma,<WH4927> Dumah,<WH1746> Massa,<WH4854>
Hadad,<WH2316> Tema,<WH8485> Jetur,<WH3195> Naphish,<WH5305> and Kedemah.<WH6929>

These are the sons<WH1121> of Ishmael,<WH3458> and these are their names,<WH8034> by their villages,<WH2691> and by their encampments:<WH2918> twelve<WH8147> princes,<WH5387> according to their nations.<WH523>

These are the years<WH8141> of the life<WH2416> of Ishmael:<WH3458> one<WH3967> hundred<WH7970> thirty-seven<WH7651> years.<WH8141> He gave up the spirit<WH1478> and died,<WH4191> and was gathered<WH622> to his people.<WH5971>
They lived<WH7931> from Havilah<WH2341> to Shur<WH7793> that is before<WH6440> Egypt,<WH4714> as you go<WH935> toward Assyria.<WH804> He lived<WH5307> opposite<WH6440> all his relatives.<WH251>
This is the history<WH8435> of the generations<WH8435> of Isaac,<WH3327> Abraham<WH85>'s son.<WH1121> Abraham became the father<WH3205> of Isaac.<WH3327>

Isaac<WH3327> was forty<WH705> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he took<WH3947> Rebekah,<WH7259> the daughter<WH1323> of Bethuel<WH1328> the Syrian<WH761> of Paddan<WH6307> Aram,<WH269> the sister of Laban<WH3837> the Syrian,<WH761> to be his wife.<WH802>

Isaac<WH3327> entreated<WH6279> Yahweh<WH3068> for<WH5227> his wife,<WH802> because she was barren.<WH6135> Yahweh<WH3068> was entreated<WH6279> by him,<WH7259> and Rebekah his wife<WH802> conceived.<WH2029>
The children<WH1121> struggled together<WH7533> within her.<WH7130> She said,<WH559> "If it be so,<WH2088> why do I live?" She went<WH3212> to inquire<WH1875> of Yahweh.<WH3068>

Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to her,<WH8147> "Two nations<WH1471> are in your womb.<WH990> Two<WH8147> peoples<WH3816> will be separated<WH6504> from your body.<WH4578> The one people<WH3816> will be stronger<WH553> than the other people.<WH3816> The elder<WH7227> will serve<WH5647> the younger.<WH6810>"
When her days<WH3117> to be delivered<WH3205> were fulfilled,<WH4390> behold,<WH8380> there were twins in her womb.<WH990>
The first<WH7223> came out<WH3318> red<WH132> all over,<WH8181> like a hairy garment.<WH155> They named<WH8034> him<WH7121> Esau.<WH6215>

After<WH310> that,<WH251> his brother came<WH3318> out,<WH3318> and his hand<WH3027> had hold<WH270> on Esau<WH6215>'s heel.<WH6119> He was<WH7121> named<WH8034> Jacob.<WH3290> Isaac<WH3327> was sixty<WH8346> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when she bore them.<WH3205>
The boys<WH5288> grew.<WH1431> Esau<WH6215> was a skillful<WH3045> hunter,<WH6718> a man<WH376> of the field.<WH7704> Jacob<WH3290> was a quiet<WH8535> man,<WH376> living<WH3427> in tents.<WH168>
Now Isaac<WH3327> loved<WH157> Esau,<WH6215> because he ate<WH6310> his venison.<WH6718> Rebekah<WH7259> loved<WH157> Jacob.<WH3290>
Jacob<WH3290> boiled<WH2102> stew.<WH5138> Esau<WH6215> came<WH935> in from the field,<WH7704> and he was famished.<WH5889>

Esau<WH6215> said<WH559> to Jacob,<WH3290> "Please feed<WH3938> me with<WH4480> that same<WH122> red<WH122> stew,<WH5889> for I am famished." Therefore his name<WH8034> was called<WH7121> Edom.<WH123>
Jacob<WH3290> said,<WH559> "First,<WH4376> sell me<WH3117> your birthright.<WH1062>"
Esau<WH6215> said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH1980> I am about to die.<WH4191> What good is the birthright to me?<WH1062>"
Jacob<WH3290> said,<WH559> "Swear<WH7650> to me first.<WH3117>" He swore<WH7650> to him.<WH4376> He sold his birthright<WH1062> to Jacob.<WH3290>

Jacob<WH3290> gave<WH5414> Esau<WH6215> bread<WH3899> and stew<WH5138> of lentils.<WH5742> He ate<WH398> and drank,<WH8354> rose up,<WH6965> and went his way.<WH3212> So Esau<WH6215> despised<WH959> his birthright.<WH1062>
